trans-unit.source: Getting started with .NET Core on Windows
trans-unit.target: Getting started with .NET Core on Windows

trans-unit.source: Getting started with .NET Core on Windows, using Visual Studio 2015
trans-unit.target: Getting started with .NET Core on Windows, using Visual Studio 2015

trans-unit.source: .NET, .NET Core
trans-unit.target: .NET, .NET Core

trans-unit.source: Getting started with .NET Core on Windows, using Visual Studio 2015
trans-unit.target: Getting started with .NET Core on Windows, using Visual Studio 2015

trans-unit.source: by [Bertrand Le Roy](https://github.com/bleroy) and [Phillip Carter](https://github.com/cartermp)
trans-unit.target: by [Bertrand Le Roy](https://github.com/bleroy) and [Phillip Carter](https://github.com/cartermp)

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio 2015 provides a full-featured development environment for developing .NET Core applications.
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio 2015 provides a full-featured development environment for developing .NET Core applications.

trans-unit.source: The procedures in this document describe the steps necessary to build a number of typical .NET Core solutions, or solutions that include .NET Core components, using Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: The procedures in this document describe the steps necessary to build a number of typical .NET Core solutions, or solutions that include .NET Core components, using Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: The scenarios include testing and using third-party libraries that have not been explicitly built for the most recent version of .NET Core.
trans-unit.target: The scenarios include testing and using third-party libraries that have not been explicitly built for the most recent version of .NET Core.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Follow the instructions on [our prerequisites page](../windows-prerequisites.md) to update your environment.
trans-unit.target: Follow the instructions on [our prerequisites page](../windows-prerequisites.md) to update your environment.

trans-unit.source: Getting Started
trans-unit.target: Getting Started

trans-unit.source: The following steps will set up Visual Studio 2015 for .NET Core development:
trans-unit.target: The following steps will set up Visual Studio 2015 for .NET Core development:

trans-unit.source: Open Visual Studio, and on the **File** menu, choose **New**, **Project**.
trans-unit.target: Open Visual Studio, and on the **File** menu, choose **New**, **Project**.

trans-unit.source: In the **New Project** dialog, in the **Templates** list, expand the **Visual C#** node and choose **.NET Core**.
trans-unit.target: In the **New Project** dialog, in the **Templates** list, expand the **Visual C#** node and choose **.NET Core**.

trans-unit.source: You should see three new project templates for **Class Library (.NET Core)**, **Console Application (.NET Core)**, and **ASP.NET Core Web Application (.NET Core)**.
trans-unit.target: You should see three new project templates for **Class Library (.NET Core)**, **Console Application (.NET Core)**, and **ASP.NET Core Web Application (.NET Core)**.

trans-unit.source: A solution using only .NET Core projects
trans-unit.target: A solution using only .NET Core projects

trans-unit.source: Writing the library
trans-unit.target: Writing the library

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, choose **File**, **New**, **Project**.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, choose **File**, **New**, **Project**.

trans-unit.source: In the **New Project** dialog, expand the **Visual C#** node and choose the **.NET Core** node, and then choose **Class Library (.NET Core)**.
trans-unit.target: In the **New Project** dialog, expand the **Visual C#** node and choose the **.NET Core** node, and then choose **Class Library (.NET Core)**.

trans-unit.source: Name the project "Library" and the solution "Golden".
trans-unit.target: Name the project "Library" and the solution "Golden".

trans-unit.source: Leave **Create directory for solution** checked.
trans-unit.target: Leave **Create directory for solution** checked.

trans-unit.source: Click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: Click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: In Solution Explorer, open the context menu for the **References** node and choose **Manage NuGet Packages**.
trans-unit.target: In Solution Explorer, open the context menu for the **References** node and choose **Manage NuGet Packages**.

trans-unit.source: Choose "nuget.org" as the **Package source**, and choose the **Browse** tab.
trans-unit.target: Choose "nuget.org" as the **Package source**, and choose the **Browse** tab.

trans-unit.source: Check the **Include prerelease** checkbox, and then browse for **Newtonsoft.Json**.
trans-unit.target: Check the **Include prerelease** checkbox, and then browse for **Newtonsoft.Json**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Install**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Install**.

trans-unit.source: Open the context menu for the **References** node and choose **Restore packages**.
trans-unit.target: Open the context menu for the **References** node and choose **Restore packages**.

trans-unit.source: Rename the `Class1.cs` file to `Thing.cs`.
trans-unit.target: Rename the `Class1.cs` file to `Thing.cs`.

trans-unit.source: Accept the rename of the class.
trans-unit.target: Accept the rename of the class.

trans-unit.source: Remove the constructor and add a method:
trans-unit.target: Remove the constructor and add a method:

trans-unit.source: On the **Build** menu, choose **Build Solution**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Build** menu, choose **Build Solution**.

trans-unit.source: The solution should build without error.
trans-unit.target: The solution should build without error.

trans-unit.source: Writing the test project
trans-unit.target: Writing the test project

trans-unit.source: In Solution Explorer, open the context menu for the **Solution** node and choose **Add**, **New Solution Folder**.
trans-unit.target: In Solution Explorer, open the context menu for the **Solution** node and choose **Add**, **New Solution Folder**.

trans-unit.source: Name the folder "test".
trans-unit.target: Name the folder "test".

trans-unit.source: This is only a solution folder, not a physical folder.
trans-unit.target: This is only a solution folder, not a physical folder.

trans-unit.source: Open the context menu for the **test** folder and choose **Add**.
trans-unit.target: Open the context menu for the **test** folder and choose **Add**.

trans-unit.source: **New Project**.
trans-unit.target: **New Project**.

trans-unit.source: In the **New Project** dialog, choose **Console Application (.NET Core)**.
trans-unit.target: In the **New Project** dialog, choose **Console Application (.NET Core)**.

trans-unit.source: Name it "TestLibrary" and explicitly put it under the `Golden\test` path.
trans-unit.target: Name it "TestLibrary" and explicitly put it under the `Golden\test` path.

trans-unit.source: Important
trans-unit.target: Important

trans-unit.source: The project needs to be a console application, not a class library.
trans-unit.target: The project needs to be a console application, not a class library.

trans-unit.source: In the **TestLibrary** project, open the context menu for the **References** node and choose **Add Reference**.
trans-unit.target: In the **TestLibrary** project, open the context menu for the **References** node and choose **Add Reference**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Reference Manager** dialog, check **Library** under the **Projects**, **Solution** node, and then click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Reference Manager** dialog, check **Library** under the **Projects**, **Solution** node, and then click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: In the **TestLibrary** project, open the `project.json` file, and replace `"Library": "1.0.0-*"` with `"Library": {"target": "project", "version": "1.0.0-*"}`.
trans-unit.target: In the **TestLibrary** project, open the `project.json` file, and replace `"Library": "1.0.0-*"` with `"Library": {"target": "project", "version": "1.0.0-*"}`.

trans-unit.source: This is to avoid the resolution of the `Library` project to a NuGet package with the same name.
trans-unit.target: This is to avoid the resolution of the `Library` project to a NuGet package with the same name.

trans-unit.source: Explicitly setting the target to "project" ensures that the tooling will first search for a project with that name, and not a package.
trans-unit.target: Explicitly setting the target to "project" ensures that the tooling will first search for a project with that name, and not a package.

trans-unit.source: In the **TestLibrary** project, open the context menu for the **References** node and choose **Restore Packages**.
trans-unit.target: In the **TestLibrary** project, open the context menu for the **References** node and choose **Restore Packages**.

trans-unit.source: Open the context menu for the **References** node and choose **Manage NuGet Packages**.
trans-unit.target: Open the context menu for the **References** node and choose **Manage NuGet Packages**.

trans-unit.source: Choose "nuget.org" as the **Package source**, and choose the **Browse** tab.
trans-unit.target: Choose "nuget.org" as the **Package source**, and choose the **Browse** tab.

trans-unit.source: Check the **Include prerelease** checkbox, and then browse for **xUnit** version 2.2.0 or newer, and then click **Install**.
trans-unit.target: Check the **Include prerelease** checkbox, and then browse for **xUnit** version 2.2.0 or newer, and then click **Install**.

trans-unit.source: Browse for **dotnet-test-xunit** version 2.2.0 or newer, and then click **Install**.
trans-unit.target: Browse for **dotnet-test-xunit** version 2.2.0 or newer, and then click **Install**.

trans-unit.source: Edit `project.json` and replace `"imports": "dnxcore50"` with `"imports": [ "dnxcore50", "portable-net45+win8" ]`.
trans-unit.target: Edit `project.json` and replace `"imports": "dnxcore50"` with `"imports": [ "dnxcore50", "portable-net45+win8" ]`.

trans-unit.source: This enables the xunit libraries to be correctly restored and used by the project: those libraries have been compiled to be used with portable profiles that include "portable-net45+win8", but not .NET Core, which didn't exist when they were built.
trans-unit.target: This enables the xunit libraries to be correctly restored and used by the project: those libraries have been compiled to be used with portable profiles that include "portable-net45+win8", but not .NET Core, which didn't exist when they were built.

trans-unit.source: The `import` relaxes the tooling version checks at build time.
trans-unit.target: The `import` relaxes the tooling version checks at build time.

trans-unit.source: You may now restore packages without error.
trans-unit.target: You may now restore packages without error.

trans-unit.source: Edit `project.json` to add `"testRunner": "xunit",` after the `"frameworks"` section.
trans-unit.target: Edit `project.json` to add `"testRunner": "xunit",` after the `"frameworks"` section.

trans-unit.source: Add a `LibraryTests.cs` class file to the **TestLibrary** project, add the `using` directives `using Xunit;` and `using Library;` to the top of the file, and add the following code to the class:
trans-unit.target: Add a `LibraryTests.cs` class file to the **TestLibrary** project, add the `using` directives `using Xunit;` and `using Library;` to the top of the file, and add the following code to the class:

trans-unit.source: Optionally, delete the `Program.cs` file from the **TestLibrary** project, and remove `"buildOptions": {"emitEntryPoint": true},` from `project.json`.
trans-unit.target: Optionally, delete the `Program.cs` file from the **TestLibrary** project, and remove `"buildOptions": {"emitEntryPoint": true},` from `project.json`.

trans-unit.source: You should now be able to build the solution.
trans-unit.target: You should now be able to build the solution.

trans-unit.source: On the **Test** menu, choose **Windows**, **Test Explorer**, and in Test Explorer choose **Run All**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Test** menu, choose **Windows**, **Test Explorer**, and in Test Explorer choose **Run All**.

trans-unit.source: The test should pass.
trans-unit.target: The test should pass.

trans-unit.source: Writing the console app
trans-unit.target: Writing the console app

trans-unit.source: In Solution Explorer, open the context menu for the `src` folder, and add a new **Console Application (.NET Core)** project.
trans-unit.target: In Solution Explorer, open the context menu for the `src` folder, and add a new **Console Application (.NET Core)** project.

trans-unit.source: Name it "App", and set the location to `Golden\src`.
trans-unit.target: Name it "App", and set the location to `Golden\src`.

trans-unit.source: In the **App** project, open the context menu for the **References** node and choose **Add**, **Reference**.
trans-unit.target: In the **App** project, open the context menu for the **References** node and choose **Add**, **Reference**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Reference Manager** dialog, check **Library** under the **Projects**, **Solution** node, and then click **OK**
trans-unit.target: In the **Reference Manager** dialog, check **Library** under the **Projects**, **Solution** node, and then click **OK**

trans-unit.source: In the **App** project, open the `project.json` file, and replace `"Library": "1.0.0-*"` with `"Library": {"target": "project"}`.
trans-unit.target: In the **App** project, open the `project.json` file, and replace `"Library": "1.0.0-*"` with `"Library": {"target": "project"}`.

trans-unit.source: Open the context menu for the **References** node and choose **Restore Packages**.
trans-unit.target: Open the context menu for the **References** node and choose **Restore Packages**.

trans-unit.source: Open the context menu for the **App** node and choose **Set as StartUp Project**.
trans-unit.target: Open the context menu for the **App** node and choose **Set as StartUp Project**.

trans-unit.source: Open the `Program.cs` file, add a `using Library;` directive to the top of the file, and then add `Console.WriteLine($"The answer is {new Thing().Get(42)}");` to the `Main` method.
trans-unit.target: Open the `Program.cs` file, add a `using Library;` directive to the top of the file, and then add `Console.WriteLine($"The answer is {new Thing().Get(42)}");` to the `Main` method.

trans-unit.source: Set a breakpoint after the line that you just added.
trans-unit.target: Set a breakpoint after the line that you just added.

trans-unit.source: Press F5 to run the application..
trans-unit.target: Press F5 to run the application..

trans-unit.source: The application should build without error, and should hit the breakpoint.
trans-unit.target: The application should build without error, and should hit the breakpoint.

trans-unit.source: You should also be able to check that the application output "The answer is 42.".
trans-unit.target: You should also be able to check that the application output "The answer is 42.".

trans-unit.source: A mixed .NET Core library and .NET Framework application
trans-unit.target: A mixed .NET Core library and .NET Framework application

trans-unit.source: Starting from the solution obtained with the previous script, execute the following steps:
trans-unit.target: Starting from the solution obtained with the previous script, execute the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the **Library** project, open the context menu for the **References** node and choose **Restore Packages**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Library** project, open the context menu for the **References** node and choose **Restore Packages**.

trans-unit.source: The solution should still build and function exactly like it did before: the test should pass, and the console application should run and be debuggable.
trans-unit.target: The solution should still build and function exactly like it did before: the test should pass, and the console application should run and be debuggable.

trans-unit.source: In the **Library** project, open the context menu and choose **Build**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Library** project, open the context menu and choose **Build**.

trans-unit.source: In Solution Explorer, open the context menu for the `src` folder, and choose **Add**.
trans-unit.target: In Solution Explorer, open the context menu for the `src` folder, and choose **Add**.

trans-unit.source: , **New Project**.
trans-unit.target: , **New Project**.

trans-unit.source: In the **New Project** dialog, choose the **Visual C#** node, and then choose **Console Application**.
trans-unit.target: In the **New Project** dialog, choose the **Visual C#** node, and then choose **Console Application**.

trans-unit.source: Important
trans-unit.target: Important

trans-unit.source: Make sure you choose a standard console application, not the .NET Core version.
trans-unit.target: Make sure you choose a standard console application, not the .NET Core version.

trans-unit.source: In this section, you'll be consuming the library from a .NET Framework application
trans-unit.target: In this section, you'll be consuming the library from a .NET Framework application

trans-unit.source: Name the project "FxApp", and set the location to `Golden\src`.
trans-unit.target: Name the project "FxApp", and set the location to `Golden\src`.

trans-unit.source: In the **FxApp** project, open the context menu for the **References** node and choose **Add Reference**.
trans-unit.target: In the **FxApp** project, open the context menu for the **References** node and choose **Add Reference**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Reference Manager** dialog, choose **Browse** and browse to the location of the built `Library.dll` (under the ..Golden\src\Library\bin\Debug\netstandard1.4 path), and then click **Add**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Reference Manager** dialog, choose **Browse** and browse to the location of the built `Library.dll` (under the ..Golden\src\Library\bin\Debug\netstandard1.4 path), and then click **Add**.

trans-unit.source: You could also package the library and reference the package, as another way to reference .NET Core code from the .NET Framework.
trans-unit.target: You could also package the library and reference the package, as another way to reference .NET Core code from the .NET Framework.

trans-unit.source: Open the context menu for the **References** node and choose **Manage NuGet Packages**.
trans-unit.target: Open the context menu for the **References** node and choose **Manage NuGet Packages**.

trans-unit.source: Choose "nuget.org" as the **Package source**, and choose the **Browse** tab.
trans-unit.target: Choose "nuget.org" as the **Package source**, and choose the **Browse** tab.

trans-unit.source: Check the **Include prerelease** checkbox, and then browse for **Newtonsoft.Json**.
trans-unit.target: Check the **Include prerelease** checkbox, and then browse for **Newtonsoft.Json**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Install**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Install**.

trans-unit.source: In the **FxApp** project, open the `Program.cs` file and add a `using Library;` directive to the top of the file, and add `Console.WriteLine($"The answer is {new Thing().Get(42)}.");` to the `Main` method of the program.
trans-unit.target: In the **FxApp** project, open the `Program.cs` file and add a `using Library;` directive to the top of the file, and add `Console.WriteLine($"The answer is {new Thing().Get(42)}.");` to the `Main` method of the program.

trans-unit.source: Set a breakpoint after the line that you just added.
trans-unit.target: Set a breakpoint after the line that you just added.

trans-unit.source: Make **FxApp** the startup application for the solution.
trans-unit.target: Make **FxApp** the startup application for the solution.

trans-unit.source: Press F5 to run the app.
trans-unit.target: Press F5 to run the app.

trans-unit.source: The application should build and hit the breakpoint.
trans-unit.target: The application should build and hit the breakpoint.

trans-unit.source: The application output should be "The answer is 42.".
trans-unit.target: The application output should be "The answer is 42.".

trans-unit.source: Moving a library from netstandard 1.4 to 1.3
trans-unit.target: Moving a library from netstandard 1.4 to 1.3

trans-unit.source: In Solution Explorer, open the `project.json` file in the **Library** project.
trans-unit.target: In Solution Explorer, open the `project.json` file in the **Library** project.

trans-unit.source: Replace `frameworks": { "netstandard1.4" }` with `frameworks": { "netstandard1.3" }`.
trans-unit.target: Replace `frameworks": { "netstandard1.4" }` with `frameworks": { "netstandard1.3" }`.

trans-unit.source: In the **Library** project, open the context menu for the **References** node and choose **Restore Packages**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Library** project, open the context menu for the **References** node and choose **Restore Packages**.

trans-unit.source: On the **Build** menu, choose **Build Library**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Build** menu, choose **Build Library**.

trans-unit.source: Remove the `Library` reference from the **FxApp** then add it back using the ..Golden\src\Library\bin\Debug\netstandard1.3 path.
trans-unit.target: Remove the `Library` reference from the **FxApp** then add it back using the ..Golden\src\Library\bin\Debug\netstandard1.3 path.

trans-unit.source: This will now reference the 1.3 version.
trans-unit.target: This will now reference the 1.3 version.

trans-unit.source: Press F5 to run the application.
trans-unit.target: Press F5 to run the application.

trans-unit.source: Everything should still work as it did before.
trans-unit.target: Everything should still work as it did before.

trans-unit.source: Check that the application output is "The answer is 42.", that the breakpoint was hit, and that variables can be inspected.
trans-unit.target: Check that the application output is "The answer is 42.", that the breakpoint was hit, and that variables can be inspected.

trans-unit.source: A mixed PCL library and .NET Framework application
trans-unit.target: A mixed PCL library and .NET Framework application

trans-unit.source: Close the previous solution if it was open: you will be starting a new script from this section on.
trans-unit.target: Close the previous solution if it was open: you will be starting a new script from this section on.

trans-unit.source: Writing the library
trans-unit.target: Writing the library

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, choose **File**, **New**, **Project**.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, choose **File**, **New**, **Project**.

trans-unit.source: In the **New Project** dialog, expand the **Visual C#** node, and choose **Class Library (Portable for iOS, Android and Windows)**.
trans-unit.target: In the **New Project** dialog, expand the **Visual C#** node, and choose **Class Library (Portable for iOS, Android and Windows)**.

trans-unit.source: Name the project "PCLLibrary" and the solution "GoldenPCL".
trans-unit.target: Name the project "PCLLibrary" and the solution "GoldenPCL".

trans-unit.source: Leave **Create directory for solution** checked.
trans-unit.target: Leave **Create directory for solution** checked.

trans-unit.source: Click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: Click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: In Solution Explorer, open the context menu for the **References** node and choose **Manage NuGet Packages**.
trans-unit.target: In Solution Explorer, open the context menu for the **References** node and choose **Manage NuGet Packages**.

trans-unit.source: Choose "nuget.org" as the **Package source**, and choose the **Browse** tab.
trans-unit.target: Choose "nuget.org" as the **Package source**, and choose the **Browse** tab.

trans-unit.source: Check the **Include prerelease** checkbox, and then browse for **Newtonsoft.Json**.
trans-unit.target: Check the **Include prerelease** checkbox, and then browse for **Newtonsoft.Json**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Install**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Install**.

trans-unit.source: Rename the class "Thing" and add a method:
trans-unit.target: Rename the class "Thing" and add a method:

trans-unit.source: On the **Build** menu, choose **Build Solution**, and verify that the solution builds.
trans-unit.target: On the **Build** menu, choose **Build Solution**, and verify that the solution builds.

trans-unit.source: Writing the console app
trans-unit.target: Writing the console app

trans-unit.source: In Solution Explorer, open the context menu for the **Solution 'GoldenPCL'** node and choose **Add**.
trans-unit.target: In Solution Explorer, open the context menu for the **Solution 'GoldenPCL'** node and choose **Add**.

trans-unit.source: **New Project**.
trans-unit.target: **New Project**.

trans-unit.source: In the **New Project** dialog, expand the **Visual C#** node, choose **Console Application**, and name the project "App".
trans-unit.target: In the **New Project** dialog, expand the **Visual C#** node, choose **Console Application**, and name the project "App".

trans-unit.source: In the **App** project, open the context menu for the **References** node and choose **Add**, **Reference**.
trans-unit.target: In the **App** project, open the context menu for the **References** node and choose **Add**, **Reference**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Reference Manager** dialog, choose **Browse** and browse to the location of the built `PCLLibrary.dll` (under the ..\GoldenPCL\PCLLibrary\bin\Debug path), and then click **Add**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Reference Manager** dialog, choose **Browse** and browse to the location of the built `PCLLibrary.dll` (under the ..\GoldenPCL\PCLLibrary\bin\Debug path), and then click **Add**.

trans-unit.source: In the **App** project, open the `Program.cs` file and add a `using PCLLibrary;` directive to the top of the file, and add `Console.WriteLine($"The answer is {new Thing().Get(42)}.");` to the `Main` method of the program.
trans-unit.target: In the **App** project, open the `Program.cs` file and add a `using PCLLibrary;` directive to the top of the file, and add `Console.WriteLine($"The answer is {new Thing().Get(42)}.");` to the `Main` method of the program.

trans-unit.source: Set a breakpoint after the line that you just added..
trans-unit.target: Set a breakpoint after the line that you just added..

trans-unit.source: In Solution Explorer, open the context menu for the **App** node and choose **Set as StartUp Project**.
trans-unit.target: In Solution Explorer, open the context menu for the **App** node and choose **Set as StartUp Project**.

trans-unit.source: Press F5 to run the app.
trans-unit.target: Press F5 to run the app.

trans-unit.source: The application should build, run, and hit the breakpoint after it outputs "The answer is 42.".
trans-unit.target: The application should build, run, and hit the breakpoint after it outputs "The answer is 42.".

trans-unit.source: Moving a PCL to a NetStandard library
trans-unit.target: Moving a PCL to a NetStandard library

trans-unit.source: The Portable Class Library tooling can automatically modify your PCL to target .NET Standard.
trans-unit.target: The Portable Class Library tooling can automatically modify your PCL to target .NET Standard.

trans-unit.source: Double click on the Properties node to open the Project Property page*
trans-unit.target: Double click on the Properties node to open the Project Property page*

trans-unit.source: Under the Targeting header click the hyperlink Target .NET Platform Standard
trans-unit.target: Under the Targeting header click the hyperlink Target .NET Platform Standard

trans-unit.source: Click Yes when asked for confirmation
trans-unit.target: Click Yes when asked for confirmation

trans-unit.source: The tooling will automatically select the version of .NET Standard that includes all of the targets originally targeted by your PCL.
trans-unit.target: The tooling will automatically select the version of .NET Standard that includes all of the targets originally targeted by your PCL.

trans-unit.source: You can target a different version of .NET Standard using the .NET Standard dropdown in the project property page.
trans-unit.target: You can target a different version of .NET Standard using the .NET Standard dropdown in the project property page.

trans-unit.source: If you previously had a packages.config, you may be prompted to uninstall any installed packages before the conversion.
trans-unit.target: If you previously had a packages.config, you may be prompted to uninstall any installed packages before the conversion.

trans-unit.source: Manually edit project.json to target .NET Standard from an existing Portable Class Library
trans-unit.target: Manually edit project.json to target .NET Standard from an existing Portable Class Library

trans-unit.source: If your project.json contains dnxcore50 in the supports element, remove it.
trans-unit.target: If your project.json contains dnxcore50 in the supports element, remove it.

trans-unit.source: Remove the dependency on Microsoft.NETCore
trans-unit.target: Remove the dependency on Microsoft.NETCore

trans-unit.source: Modify the dependency on Microsoft.NETCore.Portable.Compatibility version 1.0.0 to version 1.0.1
trans-unit.target: Modify the dependency on Microsoft.NETCore.Portable.Compatibility version 1.0.0 to version 1.0.1

trans-unit.source: Add a dependency on NETStandard.Library version 1.6.0
trans-unit.target: Add a dependency on NETStandard.Library version 1.6.0

trans-unit.source: From the frameworks element, remove the dotnet framework (and the imports element within it)
trans-unit.target: From the frameworks element, remove the dotnet framework (and the imports element within it)

trans-unit.source: Add ` "netstandard1.x : { } ` to the frameworks element, where x is replaced with the version of .NET Standard you want to target
